jrtr
Class GLRenderPanel

java.lang.Object
  jrtr.GLRenderPanel
All Implemented Interfaces:
RenderPanel
public abstract class GLRenderPanel
extends java.lang.Object
implements RenderPanel

An implementation of the RenderPanel interface using OpenGL. Its purpose is to provide an AWT component that displays the rendered image. The class GLRenderContext performs the actual rendering. The user needs to extend this class and provide an implementation for the init call-back function.

Nested Class Summary
private  class GLRenderPanel.GLRenderContextEventListener
          An event listener for the GLJPanel to which this context renders.
 
Field Summary
private  javax.media.opengl.awt.GLCanvas canvas
          Because of problems with the computers in the ExWi pool, we are using GLCanvas, which is based on AWT, instead of GLJPanel, which is based on Swing.

Method Summary

          Return the AWT component that contains the rendered image.

Field Detail

canvas

private javax.media.opengl.awt.GLCanvas canvas
Because of problems with the computers in the ExWi pool, we are using GLCanvas, which is based on AWT, instead of GLJPanel, which is based on Swing.

Method Detail

getCanvas

public final java.awt.Component getCanvas()
Return the AWT component that contains the rendered image. The user application needs to call this. The returned component is usually added to an application window.

Specified by:

public abstract void init(RenderContext renderContext)
This call-back function needs to be implemented by the user.
